pageContext.title: 8 rising startups in Southeast Asia you need to look at
pageContext.content:
Which are the startups that are on the path to becoming the next big thing? In this regular post, we give you an overview of the companies that have raised money in the past week, as well as those that we think investors should look at. Want your startup featured on this list? Details below.

1. Kopi Kenangan (Indonesia)

Kopi Kenangan is a “smart” coffee shop business that aims to push “new retail” concepts using technology.

Amount raised: US$8 million
Round: Seed
Investors: Alpha JWC Ventures
More info

2. Fastwork (Thailand)

Fastwork is aiming to become a leading “gig economy” marketplace for connecting freelancers with startups and small and medium-sized enterprises across the region.

Amount raised: US$4.8 million
Round: Series A
Investors: Led by Gobi Partners
More info

3. Get (Singapore)

Get is a campus marketplace that facilitates payments for stuff like merchandise, memberships, and events by university clubs and societies. More than 400 organizations with 220,000 members use Get across its three markets.

Amount raised: US$2.5 million
Round: Post-seed
Investors: Led by Vertex Ventures and joined by existing angel investor Click Ventures
More info

4. Growsari (Phillipines)

A play on the word “grocery,” Growsari uses technology to boost earnings for mom-and-pop stores.

More info

5. Bot MD (Singapore)

Bot MD is an AI-powered assistant that answers clinical questions, transcribes patient notes, and serves as a medical calculator.

Amount raised: US$120,000
Round: Seed
Investors: Y Combinator
More info

6. Meal Temple Group (Cambodia)

Meal Temple Group operates food-delivery platform MealTemple and online supermarket GroceryDelivery.asia.

Amount raised:Six-figure round in US dollars
Round: Undisclosed
Investors: Undisclosed
More info

7. Aide (Philippines)

Aide is a startup delivering healthcare services to patients’ doorsteps.

Amount raised: Undisclosed
Round: Undisclosed
Investors: Ayala Healthcare Holdings (AC Health)
More info

8. Crowde (Indonesia)

Crowde is an agriculture-focused P2P lending platform.

Amount raised: Undisclosed
Round: Seed
Investors: Led by Gree Ventures and joined by Crevisse Partners
More info

Is your startup headquartered in Southeast Asia? Want your startup to be featured in future editions of this list? Here are the steps:

  1. Check if your startup’s profile already exists on Tech in Asia through our company search feature.
  2. Go to the create a company profile page. You’ll need an account to be able to do so. Fill out the name of your company. If your company profile is already in our database, you have the option of claiming it and modifying the details. If your company profile doesn’t exist, please create one.
  3. Fill out this form with your startup’s details. We’ll review it when we make a new list.

Note that we have to be selective in the startups that we pick. That is because we generally want startups that might interest investors or venture capitalists. The Google form should give you an idea of what we’re looking out for. Good luck!

See previous rising startup lists here.
